results.title: The Cow who fell in the canal (K)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Hendrika was a fine Dutch cow who was very unhappy on Mr. Hofstra’s farm. Then one day she fell into the canal and floated down to the city on a raft. Peter Spier’s delightfully zany illustrations are a perfect complement to this rib-tickling tale. Based on the book of the same title written by Phyllis Krasilovsky and illustrated by Peter Spier. Narrated by Owen Jordan.

results.title: The Cow
results.creator_credit: Michael D. Murphy and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: Explores the activities of cows on a peaceful day in the pasture, using natural sound and no narration. Highlights the colours and the shapes of bodies, the textures of noses and hides, the chewing of cuds. Music by Robert Emenegger.

results.title: The Country doctor
results.brief_description: Melodrama about a doctor who despite the pleas of his wife, puts his very ill neighbour ahead of his sick daughter who has suddenly taken a turn for the worse. Cast includes Kate Bruce, Adele DeGarde, Gladys Egan, Rose King, Florence Lawrence, Mary Pickford, Frank Powell. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Coronation of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second 2nd June 1953
results.brief_description: A highlight compilation of Queen Elizabeth’s coronation on the 2nd of June 1953. Commences with Queen Elizabeth’s journey through London and her arrival at Westminster Abbey. Shows her entrance to the Abbey, and highlights of the coronation service including receiving the ‘ord’ and being ‘crowned’. Follows the procession back to Buckingham Palace and the Queen and her family greeting her ‘subjects’ from the palace balcony. Finally, the flight of jet fighters over Buckingham Palace completes the occasion.

results.title: The Coronation
results.brief_description: Shows the procession to Westminster Abbey, procedure of Queen receiving historic symbols and vestments then at crowning receiving homage of princes and peers. Shows Sir Robert Menzies in Abbey then the procession back to the Palace.

results.title: The Corn is in danger = Kornet er fare
results.creator_credit: Hagen Hasselbalch and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: Opens with scenes of the harvesting of wheat. The life cycle of the corn weevil is shown and the damage that the weevil causes to stored wheat. An agricultural expert is shown examining an infested barn where the weevils are under flooboards and in all possible cracks and crevices; the building is sprayed to kill them. Ends with an appeal to all Danes to help destroy the pest. In Danish.

results.title: The Copter kids
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spencer, Children's Film Foundation and Pacesetter Productions
results.brief_description: A children’s comedy with a social message. A group of town kids form a vigilante group to stop an irresponsible cattle rustler and his two dim-witted sons from poaching cattle from Bramble Hollow to be sold to the European Communities.

results.title: The Cop and the anthem
results.creator_credit: Peter Mark Schifter, Terry Benes and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Soapy (played by Robert Morse), an affable vagrant in New York City at the turn of the century tries many ways to get himself put into jail for the winter. A classic tale of irony and pathos. Based on the short story by O. Henry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Mark Schifter, Terry Benes and Learning Corporation of America
